Package Datastructures.Theory

Class Model

java.lang.Object
Datastructures.Theory.Model
public class Model extends Object
This class represents a propositional model, i.e. a set of literals which are supposed to be true.
Each literal in the model is accompanied by the origins, i.e. the list of basic clause ids which caused the derivation of the truth of the literal.
When a literal is added to the model, and its negation is already in the model then an Unsatisfiable exception is thrown. This may terminate the search process.
Adding a non-contradictory literal to the model causes all observers to be called. They distribute the information about the literal to the other reasoners. Created by ohlbach on 12.09.2018.

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model(int predicates, Symboltable symboltable)
      creates a model with a maximum number of predicates, together with a means of tracking the origins
      Parameters:
      predicates - the maximum number of predicates
      symboltable - the symboltable for the literals (mostly for error messages).

  • Method Details

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(BiConsumer<Integer,InferenceStep> observer)
      add a new observer which gets called when a new true literal is inserted. Submitting a thread causes the observers to be called only if this thread is different to the thread that submitted the literal. This avoids a ping pong effect.
      Parameters:
      observer - a function (literal,origins)

    • add

      public void add(int... literals) throws Unsatisfiable
      adds a literal to the model with null inference step and null thread
      Parameters:
      literals - some literals
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction is found.

    • add

      public void add(int literal, InferenceStep inferenceStep) throws Unsatisfiable
      pushes a literal onto the model and checks if the literal is already in the model. If the literal is new to the model then the observers from a thread different to the submitting thread are called.
      Parameters:
      literal - the literal for the model.
      inferenceStep - the ids of the basic clauses causing this truth
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction with an earlier entry in the model occurs.

    • addImmediately

      public void addImmediately(int literal)
      adds a literal immediately without any checks and transfers
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal

    • getModel

      public it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntArrayList getModel()
      returns the entire model, i.e. the list of true literals. Access to the list, however is not synchronized.
      Returns:
      the model

      public boolean isTrue(int literal)
      checks if the literal is true in the model.
      Parameters:
      literal - the literal to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the literal is true in the model.

    • status

      public int status(int literal)
      returns the status of the literal in the model.
      Parameters:
      literal - the literal to be checked
      Returns:
      +1 if the literal is true in the model, -1 if it is false in the model, otherwise 0.

      Returns:
